definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To clean , polish , or wash (something) by rubbing and scrubbing it vigorously , frequently with an abrasive or cleaning agent .
examples: He scoured the burnt food from the pan.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To remove debris and dirt (from something) by purging ; to sweep along or off by a current of water .
( transitive , veterinary medicine ) To clear the digestive tract (of an animal ) by administering medication that induces defecation or vomiting ; to purge .
( ambitransitive , veterinary medicine ) To ( cause livestock to) suffer from diarrhoea or dysentery .
examples: If a lamb is scouring , do not delay treatment.

definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive , obsolete ) To cleanse (something) without rubbing .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To clean , polish , or wash (something) by rubbing and scrubbing it vigorously , frequently with an abrasive or cleaning agent .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To remove debris and dirt (from something) by purging ; to sweep along or off by a current of water .
( transitive , veterinary medicine ) To clear the digestive tract (of an animal ) by administering medication that induces defecation or vomiting ; to purge .
( ambitransitive , veterinary medicine ) To ( cause livestock to) suffer from diarrhoea or dysentery .
( ambitransitive , obsolete ) To cleanse (something) without rubbing .

examples: They scoured the scene of the crime for clues.
A search engine will scour the web for you.

definitions.definition: To run with speed ; to scurry .
To move swiftly over; to brush along.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To search an area thoroughly .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To run with speed ; to scurry .
( transitive ) To move swiftly over; to brush along.
